error.signature: TS2344: Type 'X' does not satisfy the constraint 'keyof Y'. Type 'X' is not assignable to type 'string | number | symbol'.

verdict.summary: Utility types like Pick, Omit, and Record have constraints on their type parameters. The provided keys must exist on the target type.

dead_ends.action: Use any as the type argument to bypass constraints
dead_ends.why_fails: Results in a useless type that doesn't constrain anything at call sites

workarounds.action: Ensure keys passed to Pick/Omit are actual properties of the type
Use Extract to safely filter keys that exist on the type

leads_to.condition: When utility type fixes involve custom mapped types

preceded_by.condition: When generic constraint errors involve utility types

frequently_confused_with.distinction: Generic constraint is about custom generics; utility type error is specifically about built-in utility types like Pick/Omit/Record
